- European Platform on Asylum and Migration (EPAM) 
- Christian Group on Migration and Asylum  
- European Council for Refugees and Exiles (ECRE)  
- PICUM : Platform for International Cooperation on Undocumented Migrants  
- COMECE Working Group on Migration and Asylum 
- EU Migration and Development Civil Society Contact Group
goals__remit:
The International Catholic Migration Commission (ICMC) is an international non‐governmental organisation serving and protecting uprooted people, refugees, internally displaced persons and migrants, regardless of faith, race, ethnicity or nationality.  
The ICMC office in Brussels : 
-supports the ICMC Headquarters to advance the rights of refugees and migrants globally 
- promotes migrqnt rights and refugee  protection in  Europe. 
In addition  ICMC Europe implements EU financed programmes: 
°  the European Resettlement Network (www.resettlement.eu) together with IOM and UNHCR (DG Home) 
°  the SHARE programme developing a European network of cities and regions involved in/or with a commitment to refugee resettlement, protection and integration (DG Home) 
° IMPACS :  strenthening global migration and development policies in  thematic areas (DEVCO) 
° ENGAGE : civil society network buildig with partners in Africa, Asia and Latin America conditions under which migrants move, live and work.(DEVCO) 
 
Over the last years ICMC Europe, has implemented a dense agenda of policy building and advocacy focusing on the following themes:  
- Expanding legal access for refugees and migrants through humanitarian visas, student visas, humanitarian admission programmes, community based sponsorships, family reunification and mainstream legal migration channels;  
- Strengthening refugee reception and integration  though civil society – local authorities partnerships to ensure suitable housing and integration programmes and ensuring acceptance and a welcoming environment for refugees;  
- Increasing involvement of European civil society partners in migration and development policy-making.
